intro: Amorphophallus unyikae, commonly known as the Kikuyu giant arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes plants like calla lilies and taro. The plant produces large, showy inflorescences with a spadix and a spathe, typical of the genus Amorphophallus. Its underground tubers are used as a food source by local communities. The plant is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories.
